item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Steven Brust
item.description: "Always speak politely to an enraged dragon." -- Steven Brust

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "What difference does it make to the dead, the orphans and the homeless, whether the mad destruction is wrought under the name of totalitarianism or in the holy name of liberty or democracy?" -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It has always seemed strange to me...The things we admire in men, kindness and generosity, openness, honesty, understanding and feeling, are the concomitants of failure in our system. And those traits we detest, sharpness, greed, acquisitiveness, meanness, egotism and self-interest, are the traits of success. And while men admire the quality of the first they love the produce of the second." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "It's really a wonder that I haven't dropped all my ideals, because they seem so absurd and impossible to carry out. Yet I keep them, because in spite of everything, I still believe that people are really good at heart." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off." -- Stephen King

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "The best fighter is never angry." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "Ideally, what should be said to every child, repeatedly, throughout his or her school life is something like this: 'You are in the process of being indoctrinated. We have not yet evolved a system of education that is not a system of indoctrination. We are sorry, but it is the best we can do. What you are being taught here is an amalgam of current prejudice and the choices of this particular culture. The slightest look at history will show how impermanent these must be. You are being taught by people who have been able to accommodate themselves to a regime of thought laid down by their predecessors. It is a self-perpetuating system. Those of you who are more robust and individual than others will be encouraged to leave and find ways of educating yourself â€” educating your own judgements. Those that stay must remember, always, and all the time, that they are being moulded and patterned to fit into the narrow and particular needs of this particular society." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Robert F. Kennedy
item.description: "Few will have the greatness to bend history itself, but each of us can work to change a small portion of events. It is from numberless diverse acts of courage and belief that human history is shaped. Each time a man stands up for an ideal, or acts to improve the lot of others, or strikes out against injustice, he sends forth a tiny ripple of hope, and crossing each other from a million different centers of energy and daring those ripples build a current which can sweep down the mightiest walls of oppression and resistance." -- Robert F. Kennedy

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing." -- Socrates

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Nobody loves me, nobody cares, Nobody picks me peaches and pears. Nobody offers me candy and Cokes, Nobody listens and laughs at me jokes. Nobody helps when I get into a fight, Nobody does all my homework at night. Nobody misses me, Nobody cries, Nobody thinks I'm a wonderful guy. So, if you ask me who's my best friend, in a whiz, I'll stand up and tell you NOBODY is! But yesterday night I got quite a scare I woke up and Nobody just WASN'T there! I called out and reached for Nobody's hand, In the darkness where Nobody usually stands, Then I poked through the house, in each cranny and nook, But I found SOMEBODY each place that I looked. I seached till I'm tired, and now with the dawn, There's no doubt about it- NOBODY'S GONE!!" -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Brandon Mull
item.description: "I like pancakes." -- Brandon Mull

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The only reason why we ask other people how their weekend was is so we can tell them about our own weekend." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by George W. Bush
item.description: "One of the hardest parts of my job is to connect Iraq to the war on terror. " -- George W. Bush

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Walter Bagehot
item.description: "The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do." -- Walter Bagehot

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Mike Rowe
item.description: "I'm allergic to rocks hitting me in the face." -- Mike Rowe

item.title: Zarha, the groove bringer add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus
